fields.headline: Rhubarb, rhubarb
fields.bodyText: "All you have to do is look like crap on film and everyone thinks you're a brilliant actress. Actually, all you've done is look like crap." Helen Mirren gets to grips with film criticism "Radiohead isn't a democracy. Most functioning democracies don't function as a democracy. But I am built to listen to people... Which is why I'd make a really good president." Radiohead's Thom Yorke looks to the future "There's New York and LA, the cool parts where they're receptive to British bands. But there's also the bit in between, which is vast, and highly populated. And that's where we're at. We have no concept of being cool. If anything, we fight it. And those people will get off on it." Dan Hawkins of the Darkness explains how the band will conquer America "I've never read so much rubbish in all my life." Actor Antony Sher reveals why he has never been attracted to film scripts "We're faithful to bottoms out of windows and farting and red-hot pokers in a modern way, but we're not making a porn film here." Kate Bartlett, producer of The Canterbury Tales, on putting Chaucer on television "People are actually really afraid to play cowbell because they think they look stupid. But they don't, they look great." The Rapture's Vito Roccoforte reveals the secret behind real rock 'n' roll cool "I think that the power of culture is: no matter how much money you have, no matter how much power you have, life is about other things." Architect Daniel Libeskind waxes philosophical "I attended theatre school and had several opportunities to act. I am currently working in the industry and would like an opportunity within film." Euan Blair's scintillating application for a place in Film Idol, cinema's answer to Pop Idol "One of the reasons we're near the Opera House today is that I would really love to base my career on Verdi." Singer-songwriter Rufus Wainwright
